formElement.label: Knife Path:
formElement.documentation: Provide the path to the knife executable e.g /usr/bin/knife (This is the default value). (Required)

formElement.label: Client Name:
formElement.documentation: Mention the name of the client. This process will generate an RSA key pair for the named API client. The public key will be stored on the Chef server and the private key will be displayed on STDOUT or written to a named file.

formElement.label: Key Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of key to be edited.

formElement.label: New Public key name:
formElement.documentation: The name of the public key.

formElement.label: Save key to file:
formElement.documentation: Save a public key to the specified file name. If the --key-name and public-key options are not specified the Chef server will generate a private key.

formElement.label: Path to public key file:
formElement.documentation: The path to a file that contains the public key. If this option is not specified, and only if --key-name is specified, the Chef server will generate a public/private key pair.

formElement.label: Expiration date:
formElement.documentation: The expiration date for the public key, specified as an ISO 8601 formatted string: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. If this option is not specified, the public key will not have an expiration date. For example: 2013-12-24T21:00:00Z.

formElement.label: Replace key:
formElement.documentation: Generate a new public/private key pair and replace an existing public key with the newly-generated public key. To replace the public key with an existing public key, use --public-key instead.
